src:
Govorita jezik z visokimi cilji
Trener Štuhčeve Stefan Abplanalp je finiš priprav ekipi organiziral v ZDA. Mariborčanka se letos povezuje z nemško in švedsko reprezentanco.
04 Nov 2019, 08:13 by Mojca Finc
MARIBOR – Smukaška šampionka Ilka Štuhec bo v novo sezono startala 6. decembra v Lake Louise, kjer je v zimi 2016/17 dosegla premierni zmagi v karieri. Vanjo se odpravlja po poškodbi kolena in z novo ekipo, v kateri je izkušeni trener Stefan Abplanalp. Švicar, ki je nekoč žel uspehe z Lindsey Vonn, Julio Mancuso, Dominique Gisin in drugimi, resda ne razume slovensko, a z Mariborčanko govorita isti jezik – tistega s poudarkom na visokih ambicijah.V minulih dneh je z ženo obiskal Slovenijo, saj si želi čim bolj spoznati kulturo in miselnost okolja, iz katerega izhaja njegova tekmovalka, s katero se zdaj podaja v Copper Mountain, na zadnji trening, preden se začne zares.Bili ste trener v velikih in majhnih ekipah. Je Ilkina najmanjša, v kateri ste kdaj delali?»Ilkina ekipa je majhna, ni pa najmanjša. Vendar pa veličina ekipe ni vedno odvisna od števila ljudi, temveč od znanja, ki ga premore, in od tega, kako diha kot celota. S tega vidika je Ilkina ekipa velika.«Največ uspeha v karieri ste želi s Švicarkami in Američankami. Kakšna je bila dinamika v teh velikih reprezentancah?»Zame je pomembno, da znaš kot vodja ustvariti delovno klimo, v kateri je izvedba tekmovalk na najvišji možni ravni, kar vpliva na rezultatski napredek. To razpoloženje je pomembno tako v majhnih kot velikih ekipah – biti mora pravo, miselnost zmagovalna, hkrati pa je pomembno medsebojno spoštovanje med vsemi členi. Včasih je treba pritisniti, drugič zavirati. Delo z Ilko je preprosto, saj je pametna, dojemljiva sogovornica. Kadar ji postrežem s korekcijo ali novostjo, to zelo hitro vnese v svoje predstave, kar je super.«Se Ilkina ekipa še povezuje s Kanadčankami in Ester Ledecko, kot se je v prejšnji zimi? »Ledeckova verjetno ne bo nastopila na vsaki tekmi hitrih disciplin, Kanadčanke prav tako, zato sem se odločil za sodelovanje z Nemčijo in Švedsko. Obe reprezentanci imata dobre trenerje, udeležili se bosta vseh tekem pa tudi ekipi nista veliki, kar je dobro. Plus je sodelovanje z Viktorio Rebensburg, ki nastopa na Stöcklijevih smučeh in si bosta z Ilko lahko izmenjali izkušnje glede opreme.«Odmislimo Ilko. Glede na videno na treningih: kdo bo v novi sezoni nevaren? »Sofia Goggia bo hitra, Mikaela Shiffrin tudi, nanjo moramo računati v vseh disciplinah, Rebensburgova je lahko hitra v superveleslalomu, med Švicarkami izstopa Corinne Suter. Potem je tu še avstrijski paket.«Ste imeli možnost treninga s Shiffrinovo?»Ne še. Nekaj vadbe naj bi imeli v Copper Mountainu.«Kako zahtevno je bilo dobiti ta teren za priprave pred začetkom sezone?»Poznam človeka, ki je tam odgovoren za organizacijo treningov. Stari, dobri prijatelj. Tudi to, da sem bil uspešen z Američankami, mi tam odpira vrata, vedno sem dobrodošel. Skratka, ni bilo težko dobiti tega terena. Ilka je v preteklosti vselej vadila v Nakiski, sprememba ji bo dobro dela. Proga je izziv in v tem obdobju priprav za uvodno tekmo v Lake Louise to potrebujemo. Zato bo ta vadbeni blok daljši, tritedenski, dovolj bo časa, da spet pridobi tekmovalni občutek. Pa tudi proge bodo daljše od tistih v dosedanjem delu priprav, minuta in 40 sekund. Dobili bomo vse, kar trenutno potrebujemo.«Se bo Ilka lotila tudi kombinacije? Kar štiri tekme so v tekmovalnem koledarju.»Tista v Val d'Iseru bo za nas prezgodaj, a bomo videli. Veliko smo delali veleslalom, zelo je napredovala. To je disciplina, o kateri srednjeročno razmišljamo, da bi v njej tekmovala.«Letos so odšli v športni pokoj številni asi, od Hirscherja, Svindala, Vonnove do Neureutherja, Guaya ... Kakšna je prihodnost panoge, prinaša nove junake, denimo Alice Robinson?»Vsakič ko se konča eno obdobje, omogoči drugemu rodu, da se izkaže. Štuhčeva, Goggieva, Shiffrinova, Paris, Odermatt ... Vsi ti tekmovalci so že junaki, zdaj so lahko še večji, saj je prostora več. Komaj čakam, da se sezona začne tudi za nas.«
text:
They speak a language with high goals
Štuhčeva's coach Stefan Abplanalp organized the finals of the preparations for the team in the USA. The Maribor woman is connecting with the German and Swedish national teams this year.
04 Nov 2019, 08:13 by Mojca Finc
MARIBOR - Skiing champion Ilka Stuhec will head to Lake Louise in the new season on December 6, where she achieved her career premiere in the winter of 2016/17. He is recovering from a knee injury and a new team with experienced coach Stefan Abplanalp. The Swiss, who once wished success with Lindsey Vonn, Julia Mancuso, Dominique Gisin and others, does not understand Slovene, but they speak the same language with Maribor, the one with an emphasis on high ambitions. get more acquainted with the culture and mindset of his running mate, now moving to Copper Mountain, for a final training session before he really begins. You have been a coach on teams large and small. Is Ilkina the smallest you've ever worked in? ”Ilka's team is small, but not the smallest. However, the size of the team does not always depend on the number of people, but on the knowledge it has and how it breathes as a whole. From that point of view, Ilka's team is great. ”She wants the most success in her career with the Swiss and American women. What was the dynamic in these big teams? ”It is important for me as a manager to create a working climate in which the performance of the competitors is at the highest possible level, which affects the result progress. This mood is important in both small and large teams - it has to be the right one, the mindset is victorious, while the mutual respect between all the articles is important. Sometimes it has to be pressed, other times to brake. Working with Ilka is easy, as she is a smart, sensitive interlocutor. When I serve her a correction or a novelty, she brings it into her performances very quickly, which is great. ”Ilka's team still connects with Canadians and Esther Ledecko, as it did last winter? “Ledeck is not likely to compete in every fast-track race, Canadian women either, so I decided to work with Germany and Sweden. Both teams have good coaches, they will attend all the matches and the teams are not great, which is good. Plus it's a collaboration with Victoria Rebensburg, who plays on Stöckley's skis and will be able to share equipment experiences with Ilka. " According to what was seen in training: who will be dangerous in the new season? “Sofia Goggia will be fast, Mikaela Shiffrin will also have to count on her in all disciplines, Rebensburg can be fast in the super giant slalom, with Corinne Suter among the Swiss. Then there's the Austrian pack. "Have you had the chance to train with Shiffrin?" Not yet. Some workouts are supposed to be had at Copper Mountain. "How challenging was it to get this training ground before the start of the season?" I know the man in charge of training. Old, good friend. Also, being successful with American women opens the door for me there, always welcome. In short, it was not difficult to get this terrain. Ilka has always practiced in Nakiski in the past, and change will do her good. The course is a challenge, and we need that in the run-up to Lake Louise. Therefore, this training block will be longer, three weeks, and will have enough time to regain the competitive feeling. Also, the lines will be longer than those in the previous work, minutes and 40 seconds. We'll get everything we need right now. " There are as many as four matches in the competition calendar. "The one in Val d'Iser will be too early for us, but we'll see. We did a lot of giant slalom, she made great progress. This is a discipline we think about in the medium term to compete in it. ”This year, many aces went from sports to hirscher, Svindal, Vonn to Neureuther, Guy… What is the future of the industry, bringing in new heroes such as Alice Robinson ? »Each time one period ends, allow another lineage to emerge. Stuhchev, Goggieva, Shiffrinova, Paris, Odermatt ... All these contestants are already heroes, now they can be even bigger, as there is more space. I can't wait for the season to start for us too. "
